CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 10, 1953, pg. 5 reads: "Loendi Salute to Eckstine Huge Success at Famous Door - Big Night For Mr. B - When Billy Eckstine came home during Christmas Week for an engagement at the Stanley Theatre, the Loendi Club sponsored a highly successful homecoming week for the famous crooning Pittsburgher. The week of affairs was climaxed by a huge celebration at the Famous Door on Dec. 30.  Man, notables were on hand and Mr. B. received numerous gifts  in token of esteem...on hand for the party was famed bandleader Charlie Barnet, along with Mr. and Mrs. Woogie Harris and Sugar Ray, and in background can be seen WHOD disc jockey Mary Dee and Courier magazine editor George F. Brown, committee members, checking the program..."
TitMainTitle: Group, seated from left: Virginia Ross, Charles Ross, Ruth Sharpe Barnett, William "Woogie" Harris, unknown, boxer Sugar Ray Robinson, unknown man and woman, and possibly Ada Harris, with Mary Dee and George F. Brown standing in center, gathered in Famous Door Club for Billy Eckstine homecoming celebration
